cleaned_text: herb [Jump to [herba](/wiki/herba#Latin). Initial h was restored to the spelling in the 15th century on the basis on Latin, but it remained mute until the 19th century and still is for many speakers. American of the word varies; some speakers include the /h/ sound and others omit it, with the /h/-less pronunciation being the more common. Individual speakers are usually consistent in their choice, but the choice does not appear to be correlated with any regional, socioeconomic, or educational distinctions. - Outside of North America, the /h/-less pronunciation is restricted to speakers who have a general tendency to "drop the h" in all words. - The /h/-less pronunciation is the older; the pronunciation with /h/ later leaves or [seeds](/wiki/seed), etc. are used in [medicine](/wiki/medicine). - If any medicinal herbs used by witches were supposedly evil, then how come people from at least the past benefited from the healing properties of such herbs? - 1973, Joe C.
